article_text:
No one has done more to protect Senate Democrats from difficult votes than Majority Leader Harry Reid, but a funny thing is happening as another election nears. His own vulnerable Members are griping about the lack of votes.

Alaska Sen. Mark Begich was elected in 2008 and hasn't been able to get a Senate vote on any of his proposed legislative amendments. For years he was silent but suddenly he's upset, telling Politico: "Does it mean increased risks? Sure. That's what voting is about." West Virginia's Joe...

twitter.description: Senators discover the political risk of never voting on anything, the Wall Street Journal writes in an editorial.
twitter.title: Democrats Against Harry Reid

For years he was silent but suddenly he's upset, telling Politico: "Does it mean increased risks?
